International Quotes API

A free and open REST API for multilingual quotes from around the world

View on GitHub

About the Project

International Quotes API is a free-to-use service that provides access to a vast collection of quotes in multiple languages. Created to solve the lack of freely available international quote APIs, this project draws data from Wiki quote, part of the Wikimedia Foundation's free knowledge resources.

Free & Open

Both free of charge and free as in freedom, this API can be used for any project without restrictions.

Multilingual

Access quotes in multiple languages and find authors across language barriers.

AI-Enhanced

Uses Google Gemini API to process and organize unstructured data from Wiki quote.

RESTful Design

Simple and intuitive REST API allows for easy integration with any application.

Under the hood

The project faces the challenge of processing unstructured Wiki quote data, where each language has its own way of structuring pages. To solve this complexity, language models (Google Gemini API) are employed for:

  • Detecting pages about people - Identifying pages dedicated to individual authors rather than thematic collections
  • Normalizing author names - Converting various language representations of authors to standardized English forms
  • Scoring quotes - Evaluating the quality and relevance of potential quotes from the unstructured content

After processing, the data is stored in a PostgreSQL database and served through a REST API, with regular updates from Wiki quote dumps.

API Documentation

All endpoints are accessible under the base path /api/v1. The API returns JSON responses and uses standard HTTP status codes.

Authors Endpoints

GET /api/v1/authors
Lists all authors that have at least one quote in the database.

    "id": 1,

GET /api/v1/authors/:langAbbr
Lists all authors that have at least one quote in the specified language.
:langAbbr - Two-letter language code (e.g., "en", "cs", "de")

Usage Examples

Here are some examples of how to use the API in different programming languages:

JavaScript (Fetch API)

// Get a random English quote
fetch('https://api.example.com/api/v1/quotes/en/random')
  .then(response => response.json())
  .then(data => {
    console.log(`"${data.text}" - ${data.author.englishFullName}`);
  })
  .catch(error => console.error('Error:', error));

Python (Requests)

import requests

# Get all authors with Czech quotes
response = requests.get('https://api.example.com/api/v1/authors/cs')
authors = response.json()

print(f"Found {len(authors)} authors with Czech quotes:")
for author in authors:
    print(f"- {author['englishFullName']}")

PHP (cURL)

// Get supported languages
$ch = curl_init();
curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, "https://api.example.com/api/v1/languages");
curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
$response = curl_exec($ch);
curl_close($ch);

$languages = json_decode($response, true);
echo "Supported languages:\n";
foreach ($languages as $language) {
    echo "- {$language['englishName']} ({$language['abbreviation']})\n";
}
